◆ bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed()

int bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  s,
struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references *  r,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

Get data for a given subset in a compressed data bufr.

Parameters
spointer to a struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data where to set the results
rpointer to the struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references with the info about how and where to get the data
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 884 of file bufrdeco_compressed.c.

885{
886 size_t i; // references index
887
888 // Previous check
889 if ( r->refs == NULL || r->nd == 0 )
890 {
891 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed(): Try to get subset data without previous references\n" );
892 return 1;
893 }
894
895 // first some clean
896 if ( s->nd )
897 {
898 s->nd = 0;
899 }
900
901 // The subset index
902 s->ss = b->state.subset;
903
904 // then get sequence
905 for ( i = 0; i < r->nd; i++ )
906 {
907 if ( bufrdeco_get_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ) , & ( r->refs[i] ), b->state.subset, b ) )
908 return 1;
909
910 if ( r->refs[i].is_associated == 0 )
911 {
912 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
913 ( s->nd ) ++;
914 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
915 ( s->nd ) ++;
916 else
917 {
918 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
919 return 1;
920 }
921 }
922 else
923 {
924 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
925 ( s->nd ) ++;
926 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
927 ( s->nd ) ++;
928 else
929 {
930 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
931 return 1;
932 }
933 }
934 }
935 return 0;
936}

◆ bufr_find_tableb_index()

int bufr_find_tableb_index ( size_t *  index,
struct bufr_tableb *  tb,
const char *  key 
)

found a descriptor index in a struct bufr_tableb

Parameters
indexpointer to a size_t where to set the result if success
tbpointer to struct bufr_tableb where are stored all table B data
keydescriptor string in format FXXYYY

Return 0 if success, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 186 of file bufrdeco_tableb.c.

187{
188 uint32_t ix;
189 size_t i, i0;
190 char *c;
191 struct bufr_descriptor desc;
192
193 ix = strtoul ( key, &c, 10 );
194 uint32_t_to_descriptor ( &desc, ix );
195
196 // first chance
197 i0 = tb->x_start[desc.x] + tb->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y];
198 if ( tb->item[i0].x == desc.x && tb->item[i0].y == desc.y )
199 {
200 *index = i0;
201 return 0;
202 }
203 // Second chance
204 i0 = tb->x_start[desc.x];
205 for ( i = i0 ; i < i0 + tb->num[desc.x] ; i++ )
206 {
207 if ( tb->item[i].x != desc.x )
208 {
209 return 1; // descriptor not found
210 }
211 if ( tb->item[i].y == desc.y )
212 {
213 *index = i;
214 return 0; // found
215 }
216 }
217 return 1; // not found
218}

◆ bufr_read_tableb()

int bufr_read_tableb ( struct bufr_tableb *  tb,
char *  error 
)

Read a Table B file and set the result in a struct bufr_tableb.

Parameters
tbpointer to the struct bufr_tableb where to set the results
errorstring with the error explanation if any

Note that this function assumes that file is formatted as EMWCF table B Return 0 if success, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 44 of file bufrdeco_tableb.c.

45{
46 char *c;
47 FILE *t;
48 size_t i = 0;
49 uint32_t ix;
50 char l[180];
51 char caux[256];
52 struct bufr_descriptor desc;
53
54 if ( tb->path[0] == 0 )
55 {
56 return 1;
57 }
58
59 // If we've already readed this table. We just regenerate the table with original values
60 if ( strcmp ( tb->path, tb->old_path ) == 0 )
61 {
62 //printf ("Reutilizo tablas\n");
63 for ( i = 0; i < tb->nlines ; i++ )
64 {
65 tb->item[i].scale = tb->item[i].scale_ori;
66 tb->item[i].reference = tb->item[i].reference_ori;
67 tb->item[i].nbits = tb->item[i].nbits_ori;
68 tb->item[i].changed = 0;
69 }
70 return 0; // all done
71 }
72
73 strcpy ( caux, tb->path );
74 memset ( tb, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_tableb ) );
75 strcpy ( tb->path,caux );
76 if ( ( t = fopen ( tb->path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
77 {
78 sprintf ( error,"Unable to open table B file '%s'\n", tb->path );
79 return 1;
80 }
81
82 while ( fgets ( l, 180, t ) != NULL && i < BUFR_MAXLINES_TABLEB )
83 {
84 // supress the newline
85 if ( ( c = strrchr ( l,'\n' ) ) != NULL )
86 {
87 *c = '\0';
88 }
89
90 // First we build the descriptor
91 ix = strtoul ( & ( l[0] ), &c, 10 );
92 uint32_t_to_descriptor ( &desc, ix );
93 tb->item[i].changed = 0; // Original from table B
94 tb->item[i].x = desc.x; // x
95 tb->item[i].y = desc.y; // y
96 strcpy ( tb->item[i].key, desc.c ); // key
97 if ( tb->x_start[desc.x] == 0 )
98 {
99 tb->x_start[desc.x] = i; // marc the start
100 }
101 tb->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y] = i - tb->x_start[desc.x]; // marc the position from start of first x
102
103 // detailed name
104 bufr_charray_to_string ( tb->item[i].name, &l[8], 64 );
105 bufr_adjust_string ( tb->item[i].name ); // supress trailing blanks
106
107 // tyoe
108 bufr_charray_to_string ( tb->item[i].unit ,&l[73], 24 );
109 bufr_adjust_string ( tb->item[i].unit );
110
111 // escale
112 tb->item[i].scale_ori = strtol ( &l[97], &c, 10 );
113 tb->item[i].scale = tb->item[i].scale_ori;
114
115 // reference
116 tb->item[i].reference_ori = strtol ( &l[102], &c, 10 );
117 tb->item[i].reference = tb->item[i].reference_ori;
118
119 // bits
120 tb->item[i].nbits_ori = strtol ( &l[115], &c, 10 );
121 tb->item[i].nbits = tb->item[i].nbits_ori;
122
123 /*printf("%s %s %s %d %u %lu\n", tb->item[i].key, tb->item[i].name, tb->item[i].unit,
124 tb->item[i].escale, tb->item[i].reference, tb->item[i].nbits);*/
125 i++;
126 }
127 tb->x_start[0] = 0; // fix the start for x = 0
128 fclose ( t );
129 tb->nlines = i;
130 tb->wmo_table = 0;
131 strcpy ( tb->old_path, tb->path ); // store latest path
132 return 0;
133}

◆ bufr_read_tableb_csv()

int bufr_read_tableb_csv ( struct bufr_tableb *  tb,
char *  error 
)

Read a Table B file from a WMO csv formatted file and set the result in a struct bufr_tableb.

Parameters
tbpointer to the struct bufr_tableb where to set the results
errorstring with the error explanation if any

Note that this function assumes that file is csv formatted as WMO table B Return 0 if success, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 35 of file bufrdeco_tableb_csv.c.

36{
37 char *c;
38 FILE *t;
39 size_t i = 0;
40 int nt;
41 uint32_t ix;
42 char l[CSV_MAXL];
43 char caux[512];
44 char *tk[16];
45 struct bufr_descriptor desc;
46
47 if ( tb->path[0] == 0 )
48 {
49 return 1;
50 }
51
52 // If we've already readed this table. We just regenerate the table with original values
53 if ( strcmp ( tb->path, tb->old_path ) == 0 )
54 {
55 //printf ("Reutilizo tablas\n");
56 for ( i = 0; i < tb->nlines ; i++ )
57 {
58 tb->item[i].scale = tb->item[i].scale_ori;
59 tb->item[i].reference = tb->item[i].reference_ori;
60 tb->item[i].nbits = tb->item[i].nbits_ori;
61 tb->item[i].changed = 0;
62 }
63 return 0; // all done
64 }
65
66 strcpy ( caux, tb->path );
67 memset ( tb, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_tableb ) );
68 strcpy ( tb->path, caux );
69 if ( ( t = fopen ( tb->path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
70 {
71 sprintf ( error,"Unable to open table B file '%s'\n", tb->path );
72 return 1;
73 }
74
75 // read first line, it is ignored
76 fgets ( l, CSV_MAXL, t );
77
78 while ( fgets ( l, CSV_MAXL, t ) != NULL && i < BUFR_MAXLINES_TABLEB )
79 {
80 // Parse line
81 if ( parse_csv_line ( &nt, tk, l ) < 0 || nt != 7 )
82 {
83 sprintf ( error,"Error parsing csv line from table B file '%s'\n", tb->path );
84 return 1;
85 }
86
87 // First we build the descriptor
88 ix = strtoul ( tk[0], &c, 10 );
89 uint32_t_to_descriptor ( &desc, ix );
90 tb->item[i].changed = 0; // Original from table B
91 tb->item[i].x = desc.x; // x
92 tb->item[i].y = desc.y; // y
93 strcpy ( tb->item[i].key, desc.c ); // key
94 if ( tb->num[desc.x] == 0 )
95 {
96 tb->x_start[desc.x] = i; // marc the start
97 }
98 tb->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y] = i - tb->x_start[desc.x]; // marc the position from start of first x
99 ( tb->num[desc.x] )++;
100
101 // detailed name
102 if ( tk[2][0] )
103 {
104 sprintf ( caux, "%s %s", tk[1], tk[2] );
105 }
106 else
107 {
108 strcpy ( caux, tk[1] );
109 }
110
111 // Check about length
112 if ( strlen ( caux ) >= BUFR_TABLEB_NAME_LENGTH )
113 caux[BUFR_TABLEB_NAME_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
114 // and finally copy
115 strcpy ( tb->item[i].name, caux );
116
117 // unit
118 strcpy ( caux, tk[3] );
119 if ( strlen ( caux ) >= BUFR_TABLEB_UNIT_LENGTH )
120 caux[BUFR_TABLEB_UNIT_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
121 strcpy ( tb->item[i].unit, caux );
122
123 // escale
124 tb->item[i].scale_ori = strtol ( tk[4], &c, 10 );
125 tb->item[i].scale = tb->item[i].scale_ori;
126
127 // reference
128 tb->item[i].reference_ori = strtol ( tk[5], &c, 10 );
129 tb->item[i].reference = tb->item[i].reference_ori;
130
131 // bits
132 tb->item[i].nbits_ori = strtol ( tk[6], &c, 10 );
133 tb->item[i].nbits = tb->item[i].nbits_ori;
134
135 i++;
136 }
137 tb->x_start[0] = 0; // fix the start for x = 0
138 fclose ( t );
139 tb->nlines = i;
140 tb->wmo_table = 1;
141 strcpy ( tb->old_path, tb->path ); // store latest path
142 return 0;
143}

int bufr_read_tablec ( struct bufr_tablec *  tc,
char *  error 
)

Reads a file with table C content according with ECMWF format.

Parameters
tcpointer to a target struct bufr_tablec
errorstring where to set error if any

If succeded return 0, otherwise 1

Definition at line 34 of file bufrdeco_tablec.c.

35{
36 char aux[8], *c;
37 size_t startx = 0;
38 FILE *t;
39 size_t i = 0;
40 char caux[256];
41
42 if ( tc->path[0] == '\0' )
43 {
44 return 1;
45 }
46
47 // If we've already readed this table.
48 if ( strcmp ( tc->path, tc->old_path ) == 0 )
49 {
50 return 0; // all done
51 }
52
53 strcpy ( caux, tc->path );
54 memset ( tc, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_tablec ) );
55 strcpy ( tc->path,caux );
56 if ( ( t = fopen ( tc->path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
57 {
58 sprintf ( error,"Unable to open table C file '%s'\n", tc->path );
59 return 1;
60 }
61
62 while ( fgets ( tc->l[i], 96, t ) != NULL && i < BUFR_MAXLINES_TABLEC )
63 {
64 // supress the newline
65 if ( ( c = strrchr ( tc->l[i],'\n' ) ) != NULL )
66 {
67 *c = '\0';
68 }
69 if ( tc->l[i][1] != ' ' && tc->l[i][2] != ' ' )
70 {
71 aux[0] = tc->l[i][1];
72 aux[1] = tc->l[i][2];
73 aux[2] = '\0';
74 startx = strtoul ( aux, &c, 10 );
75 if ( tc->x_start[startx] == 0 )
76 {
77 tc->x_start[startx] = i; // marc the start
78 }
79 }
80 ( tc->num[startx] ) ++;
81 i++;
82 }
83 fclose ( t );
84 tc->nlines = i;
85 tc->wmo_table = 0;
86 strcpy ( tc->old_path, tc->path ); // store latest path
87 return 0;
88}

int bufr_read_tablec_csv ( struct bufr_tablec *  tc,
char *  error 
)

Reads a file with table C content (Code table and bit flags) according with csv WMO format.

Parameters
tcpointer to a target struct bufr_tablec
errorstring where to set error if any

If succeded return 0, otherwise 1

Definition at line 34 of file bufrdeco_tablec_csv.c.

35{
36 char *c;
37 FILE *t;
38 int nt;
39 uint32_t ix;
40 size_t i = 0;
41 struct bufr_descriptor desc;
42 char *tk[16];
43 char caux[256], l[CSV_MAXL];
44
45 if ( tc->path[0] == 0 )
46 {
47 return 1;
48 }
49
50 // If we've already readed this table.
51 if ( strcmp ( tc->path, tc->old_path ) == 0 )
52 {
53 return 0; // all done
54 }
55
56 strcpy ( caux, tc->path );
57 memset ( tc, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_tablec ) );
58 strcpy ( tc->path,caux );
59 if ( ( t = fopen ( tc->path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
60 {
61 sprintf ( error,"Unable to open table C file '%s'\n", tc->path );
62 return 1;
63 }
64
65 // read first line, it is ignored
66 fgets ( l, CSV_MAXL, t );
67
68 while ( fgets ( l, CSV_MAXL, t ) != NULL && i < BUFR_MAXLINES_TABLEC )
69 {
70
71 // Parse line
72 if ( parse_csv_line ( &nt, tk, l ) < 0 || nt != 6 )
73 {
74 sprintf ( error,"Error parsing csv line from table C file '%s'. Found %d fields in line %lu \n", tc->path, nt, i );
75 return 1;
76 }
77
78 // Check if code contains other than non-numeric i.e. 'All' or '-'
79 // In this case, the line is ignored
80 if ( tk[1][0] == 0 || strchr ( tk[1], '-' ) != NULL || strstr ( tk[1], "All" ) != NULL )
81 continue;
82
83 // Key
84 // First we build the descriptor
85 ix = strtoul ( tk[0], &c, 10 );
86 uint32_t_to_descriptor ( &desc, ix );
87 strcpy ( tc->item[i].key, tk[0] );
88 tc->item[i].x = desc.x;
89 tc->item[i].y = desc.y;
90
91 // Integer value
92 tc->item[i].ival = strtoul ( tk[1], &c, 10 );
93
94 // Description
95 c = & tc->item[i].description[0];
96 if ( strlen ( tk[2] ) < BUFR_EXPLAINED_LENGTH )
97 {
98 c += sprintf ( c,"%s", tk[2] );
99 if ( tk[3][0] && ( strlen ( tk[3] ) + strlen ( tc->item[i].description ) ) < BUFR_EXPLAINED_LENGTH )
100 {
101 c += sprintf ( c," %s", tk[3] );
102 if ( tk[4][0] && ( strlen ( tk[4] ) + strlen ( tc->item[i].description ) ) < BUFR_EXPLAINED_LENGTH )
103 {
104 c += sprintf ( c, " %s", tk[4] );
105 }
106 }
107 }
108 else
109 {
110 tk[2][BUFR_EXPLAINED_LENGTH - 1] = '\0';
111 c += sprintf ( c,"%s", tk[2] );
112 }
113
114 if ( tk[5][0] && ( strlen ( tk[5] ) + strlen ( tc->item[i].description ) ) < BUFR_EXPLAINED_LENGTH )
115 {
116 c += sprintf ( c,"%s", tk[5] );
117 }
118
119 if ( tc->num[desc.x] == 0 )
120 {
121 tc->x_start[desc.x] = i; // marc the start
122 }
123 if ( tc->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y] == 0 )
124 {
125 tc->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y] = i - tc->x_start[desc.x]; // marc the position from start of first x
126 }
127 ( tc->num[desc.x] ) ++;
128 //printf("%ld %s %d %d, %ld %ld\n", i, tc->item[i].key, tc->item[i].x, tc->item[i].y, tc->x_start[desc.x], tc->y_ref[desc.x][desc.y]);
129 i++;
130 }
131 fclose ( t );
132 tc->nlines = i;
133 tc->wmo_table = 1;
134 strcpy ( tc->old_path, tc->path ); // store latest path
135 return 0;
136}

35{
36 char aux[32], *c;
37 char *tk[16];
38 int nt;
39 FILE *t;
40 size_t ix = 0;
41 size_t i = 0;
42 int j0, nj = 0;
43 char oldkey[8];
44 char caux[256];
45 char laux[CSV_MAXL];
46 struct bufr_descriptor desc;
47
48 if ( td->path[0] == 0 )
49 {
50 return 1;
51 }
52
53 // Check if we've already readed this table.
54 if ( strcmp ( td->path, td->old_path ) == 0 )
55 {
56 return 0; // all done
57 }
58
59 strcpy ( caux, td->path );
60 memset ( td, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_tabled ) );
61 strcpy ( td->path,caux );
62 if ( ( t = fopen ( td->path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
63 {
64 sprintf ( error,"Unable to open table D file '%s'\n", td->path );
65 return 1;
66 }
67
68 // read first line, it is ignored
69 fgets ( laux, CSV_MAXL, t );
70
71 oldkey[0] = 0;
72 j0 = 0;
73
74 while ( fgets ( laux, CSV_MAXL, t ) != NULL && i < BUFR_MAXLINES_TABLED )
75 {
76 // Parse line
77 //printf("%s\n",laux);
78 if ( parse_csv_line ( &nt, tk, laux ) < 0 || ( nt != 2 && nt != 4) )
79 {
80 sprintf ( error,"Error parsing csv line from table D file '%s' found %d tokens in line %lu\n", td->path, nt, i );
81 return 1;
82 }
83
84 // item fields
85 strcpy(td->item[i].key, tk[0]);
86 strcpy(td->item[i].key2, tk[1]);
87
88 if (nt == 4 && tk[2][0])
89 strcpy(td->item[i].description, tk[2]);
90 else
91 td->item[i].description[0] = 0;
92
93 if (nt == 4 && tk[3][0])
94 strcpy(td->item[i].description2, tk[3]);
95 else
96 td->item[i].description2[0] = 0;
97
98 if ( strcmp ( oldkey, tk[0] ) )
99 {
100 if ( oldkey[0] )
101 {
102 // write number of descriptors in emulated ECMWF line
103 sprintf ( aux, "%s%3d", oldkey, nj );
104 td->l[j0][1] = aux[0];
105 td->l[j0][2] = aux[1];
106 td->l[j0][3] = aux[2];
107 td->l[j0][4] = aux[3];
108 td->l[j0][5] = aux[4];
109 td->l[j0][6] = aux[5];
110 td->l[j0][7] = aux[6];
111 td->l[j0][8] = aux[7];
112 td->l[j0][9] = aux[8];
113 }
114 j0 = i;
115 nj = 1;
116 }
117 else
118 {
119 nj++;
120 }
121 strcpy ( oldkey, tk[0] );
122
123 ix = strtoul ( tk[0], &c, 10 );
124 uint32_t_to_descriptor ( &desc, ix );
125
126 if ( td->num[desc.x] == 0 )
127 {
128 td->x_start[desc.x] = i; // marc the start
129 }
130 ( td->num[desc.x] ) ++;
131
132 // Now emule ECMWF format
133 sprintf ( td->l[i], " %s", tk[1] );
134 i++;
135 }
136 fclose ( t );
137
138 // Last sequence
139 sprintf ( aux, "%s%3d", oldkey, nj );
140 td->l[j0][1] = aux[0];
141 td->l[j0][2] = aux[1];
142 td->l[j0][3] = aux[2];
143 td->l[j0][4] = aux[3];
144 td->l[j0][5] = aux[4];
145 td->l[j0][6] = aux[5];
146 td->l[j0][7] = aux[6];
147 td->l[j0][8] = aux[7];
148 td->l[j0][9] = aux[8];
149
150 /*for ( kk = 0; kk < i; kk++ )
151 printf ( "%s\n", td->l[kk] );*/
152 td->nlines = i;
153 td->wmo_table = 1;
154 strcpy ( td->old_path, td->path ); // store latest path
155 return 0;
156}

165{

167 // get tablenames

188 return 1;

191 {

◆ bufr_read_tables_wmo()

int bufr_read_tables_wmo ( struct bufrdeco *  b)

Read the tables according with bufr file data from a bufr table directory.

Parameters
bbasic struct with needed data

The default directories where to search bufr tables are stored in DEFAULT_BUFRTABLES_WMO_CSV_DIR1 and DEFAULT_BUFRTABLES_WMO_CSV_DIR2

Definition at line 158 of file bufrdeco_wmo.c.

159{
160
161 // get tablenames
162 if ( get_wmo_tablenames ( b ) )
163 {
164 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_tables_ecmwf(): Cannot find bufr tables\n" );
165 return 1;
166 }
167
168 // If tables still not initialized then do it
169 if ( b->tables == NULL && bufrdeco_init_tables ( & ( b->tables ) ) )
170 {
171 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_tables_ecmwf(): Cannot allocate memory for tables\n" );
172 return 1;
173 }
174
175 // And now read tables
176 if ( bufr_read_tableb_csv ( & ( b->tables->b ), b->error ) )
177 {
178 return 1;
179 }
180
181 if ( bufr_read_tablec_csv ( & ( b->tables->c ), b->error ) )
182 {
183 return 1;
184 }

186 if ( bufr_read_tabled_csv ( & ( b->tables->d ), b->error ) )
187 {
188 return 1;
189 }
190 return 0;

◆ bufrdeco_allocate_bitmap()

int bufrdeco_allocate_bitmap ( struct bufrdeco *  b)

Definition at line 318 of file bufrdeco_memory.c.

319{
320 size_t nba = b->bitmap.nba;
321
322 if ( nba < BUFR_MAX_BITMAPS )
323 {
324 if ( b->bitmap.bmap[nba] != NULL )
325 {
326 // the bitmap already is allocated
327 return 0;
328 }
329 // let's try to allocate it!
330 if ( ( b->bitmap.bmap[nba] = ( struct bufrdeco_bitmap * ) calloc ( 1, sizeof ( struct bufrdeco_bitmap ) ) ) == NULL )
331 {
332 sprintf ( b->error,"bufrdeco_allocate_bitmap(): Cannot allocate space for struct bufrdeco_bitmap\n" );
333 return 1;
334 }
335 // Update de counter
336 ( b->bitmap.nba )++;
337 return 0;
338 }
339 else
340 {
341 sprintf ( b->error,"bufrdeco_allocate_bitmap(): Too much bitmaps to allocate. The limit is %d\n" , BUFR_MAX_BITMAPS );
342 return 1;
343 }
344}

◆ bufrdeco_clean_subset_sequence_data()

int bufrdeco_clean_subset_sequence_data ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  ba)

Cleans a struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data.

For eficience, if sequence in the struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data is allocated, just set the used elements to zero. If is still no allocated memory for sequence inits the struct

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

◆ bufrdeco_decode_data_subset()

int bufrdeco_decode_data_subset ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  s,
struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references *  r,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

User interface to decode a BUFR subset.

Parameters
spointer to the target struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data
rpointer to the struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references
bpointer to the base struct bufrdeco

Note that if succeeded the counter to current subset index is increased. Remember that in case of non compressed data we must to decode all previous subsets to get the desired one. In case of compressed we can access directly to a the desired subset

Return 0 in case of success, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 61 of file bufrdeco_data.c.

63{
64 // Check about parsed tree
65 if ( b->tree == NULL || b->tree->nseq == 0 )
66 {
67 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_subset_sequence_datad(): Try to parse compressed data without parsed tree\n" );
68 return 1;
69 }
70
71 // First we init the subset sequence data
72 if ( bufrdeco_clean_subset_sequence_data ( s ) )
73 {
74 return 1;
75 }
76
77 // also we clean the possible defined bitmaps in prior subsets
78 if ( bufrdeco_clean_bitmaps ( b ) )
79 {
80 return 1;
81 }
82
83 // Then we get the data from an already parsed descriptor tree
84 if ( b->sec3.compressed )
85 {
86 if ( r->nd == 0 /*r->refs == NULL || r->dim == 0 */ )
87 {
88 // case of compressed data and still not parsed
89 if ( bufrdeco_parse_compressed ( r, b ) )
90 {
91 return 1;
92 }
93 }
94 if ( bufr_decode_subset_data_compressed ( s, r, b ) )
95 {
96 return 1;
97 }
98 }
99 else
100 {
101 if ( bufrdeco_decode_subset_data_recursive ( s, NULL, b ) )
102 {
103 return 1;
104 }
105 }
106
107 // Finally we update the subset counter
108 ( b->state.subset ) ++;
109 return 0;
110}

◆ bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence()

int bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  s,
struct bufr_replicator *  r,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

Decodes a replicated sequence.

Parameters
starget struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data
rpointer to a struct bufr_replicator which manage the replication task
bpointer to the base struct bufrdeco

If succeeded return 0, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 365 of file bufrdeco_data.c.

366{
367 size_t i, k;
368 size_t ixloop; // Index for loop
369 size_t ixd; // Index for descriptor
370 struct bufr_sequence *l = r->s; // sequence
371 struct bufr_replicator replicator;
372
373 //printf("nloops=%lu, ndesc=%lu\n", r->nloops, r->ndesc);
374 for ( ixloop = 0; ixloop < r->nloops; ixloop++ )
375 {
376 for ( ixd = 0; ixd < r->ndesc ; ixd ++ )
377 {
378 i = ixd + r->ixdel + 1;
379 switch ( l->lseq[i].f )
380 {
381 case 0:
382 // Get data from table B
383 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[i] ) ) )
384 {
385 return 1;
386 }
387
388 // Case of defining bitmap 0 31 031
389 if ( l->lseq[i].x == 31 && l->lseq[i].y == 31 && b->state.bitmaping )
390 {
391 if ( s->sequence[s->nd].val == 0.0 ) // Check if it is meaning present data
392 {
393 s->sequence[s->nd - b->state.bitmaping].is_bitmaped_by = s->nd;
394 s->sequence[s->nd].bitmap_to = s->nd - b->state.bitmaping;
395 // Add reference to bitmap
396 bufrdeco_add_to_bitmap( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1], s->nd - b->state.bitmaping, s->nd);
397 }
398 }
399
400 // Process quality data
401 if ( b->state.quality_active &&
402 l->lseq[i].x == 33 )
403 {
404 if ( ixloop == 0 )
405 {
406 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nq;
407 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->quality[k] = s->nd;
408 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
409 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nq )++;
410 else
411 {
412 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): No more space for quality vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
413 return 1;
414 }
415 }
416 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
417 }
418
419 //case of first order statistics
420 if ( b->state.stat1_active &&
421 l->lseq[i].x == 8 && l->lseq[i].y == 23 )
422 {
423 if ( ixloop == 0 )
424 {
425 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1; // index un stqts
426 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1_desc[k] = s->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
427 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
428 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
429 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 )++;
430 else
431 {
432 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): No more space for first order statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
433 return 1;
434 }
435 }
436 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
437 }
438
439 //case of difference statistics
440 if ( b->state.dstat_active &&
441 l->lseq[i].x == 8 && l->lseq[i].y == 24 )
442 {
443 if ( ixloop == 0 )
444 {
445 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds; // index in stats
446 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->dstat_desc[k] = s->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
447 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
448 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
449 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds )++;
450 else
451 {
452 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): No more space for difference statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
453 return 1;
454 }
455 }
456 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
457 }
458
459 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
460 {
461 ( s->nd ) ++;
462 }
463 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
464 {
465 ( s->nd ) ++;
466 }
467 else
468 {
469 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
470 return 1;
471 }
472 break;
473
474 case 1:
475 // Case of replicator descriptor
476 replicator.s = l;
477 replicator.ixrep = i;
478 if ( l->lseq[i].y != 0 )
479 {
480 // no delayed
481 replicator.ixdel = i;
482 replicator.ndesc = l->lseq[i].x;
483 replicator.nloops = l->lseq[i].y;
484 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence ( s, &replicator, b );
485 ixd += replicator.ndesc; // update ixd properly
486 }
487 else
488 {
489 // case of delayed;
490 replicator.ixdel = i + 1;
491 replicator.ndesc = l->lseq[i].x;
492 // here we read ndesc from delayed replicator descriptor
493 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[i + 1] ) ) )
494 {
495 return 1;
496 }
497 replicator.nloops = ( size_t ) s->sequence[s->nd].val;
498 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
499 {
500 ( s->nd ) ++;
501 }
502 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
503 {
504 ( s->nd ) ++;
505 }
506 else
507 {
508 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
509 return 1;
510 }
511 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence ( s, &replicator, b );
512 ixd += replicator.ndesc + 1; // update ixd properly
513 }
514 //i = r->ixdel + r->ndesc; // update i properly
515 break;
516
517 case 2:
518 // Case of operator descriptor
519 if ( bufrdeco_parse_f2_descriptor ( s, & ( l->lseq[i] ), b ) )
520 {
521 return 1;
522 }
523
524 // Case of subsituted values
525 if ( b->state.subs_active && l->lseq[i].x == 23 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
526 {
527 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop]; // ref which is bitmaped_to
528 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
529 if ( ixloop == 0 )
530 {
531 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->subs = s->nd;
532 }
533 if (bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[k] ) ) )
534 {
535 return 1;
536 }
537 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
538
539 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
540 {
541 s->nd += 1;
542 }
543 else
544 {
545 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
546 return 1;
547 }
548 }
549
550 // Case of repaced/retained values
551 if ( b->state.retained_active && l->lseq[i].x == 32 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
552 {
553 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
554 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
555 if ( ixloop == 0 )
556 {
557 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->retain = s->nd;
558 }
559 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[k] ) ) )
560 {
561 return 1;
562 }
563
564 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
565 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
566 {
567 s->nd += 1;
568 }
569 else
570 {
571 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
572 return 1;
573 }
574 }
575
576 // Case of first order statistics
577 //
578 // This operator shall signify a data item containing a
579 // first-order statistical value of the type indicated by
580 // the preceding 0 08 023 element descriptor; the
581 // element descriptor to which the first-order statistic
582 // relates is obtained by the application of the data
583 // present bit-map associated with the first-order
584 // statistical values follow operator; first-order statistical
585 // values shall be represented as defined by this element
586 // descriptor.
587 if ( b->state.stat1_active && l->lseq[i].x == 24 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
588 {
589 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
590
591 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
592 if ( ixloop == 0 )
593 {
594 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1[b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 -1] = s->nd;
595 }
596
597 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[k] ) ) )
598 {
599 return 1;
600 }
601
602 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
603 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
604 {
605 s->nd += 1;
606 }
607 else
608 {
609 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
610 return 1;
611 }
612 }
613
614 // Case of difference statistics
615 //
616 // This operator shall signify a data item containing a
617 // difference statistical value of the type indicated by
618 // the preceding 0 08 024 element descriptor; the
619 // element descriptor to which the difference statistical
620 // value relates is obtained by the application of the
621 // data present bit-map associated with the difference
622 // statistical values follow operator; difference statistical
623 // values shall be represented as defined by this
624 // element descriptor, but with a reference value of –2**n
625 // and a data width of (n+1), where n is the data width
626 // given by the original descriptor. This special reference
627 // value allows the statistical difference values to
628 // be centred around zero.
629 if ( b->state.dstat_active && l->lseq[i].x == 25 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
630 {
631 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
632
633 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
634 if ( ixloop == 0 )
635 {
636 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1[b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds -1] = s->nd;
637 }
638
639 // in bufrdeco_tableb_val() is taken into acount when is difference statistics active
640 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( l->lseq[k] ) ) )
641 {
642 return 1;
643 }
644
645 /*s->sequence[s->nd].ref = - ( ( int32_t ) 1 << s->sequence[s->nd].bits );
646 s->sequence[s->nd].bits++;*/
647 s->sequence[s->nd].related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
648 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
649 {
650 s->nd += 1;
651 }
652 else
653 {
654 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
655 return 1;
656 }
657 }
658
659 break;
660
661 case 3:
662 // Case of sequence descriptor
663 if ( bufrdeco_decode_subset_data_recursive ( s, l->sons[i], b ) )
664 {
665 return 1;
666 }
667 break;
668
669 default:
670 // this case is not possible
671 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_subset_data_recursive(): Found bad 'f' in descriptor\n" );
672 return 1;
673 break;
674 }
675 }
676 }
677 return 0;
678}

◆ bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed()

int bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed ( struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references *  r,
struct bufr_replicator *  rep,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

decodes a repicated subsequence

Parameters
rpointer to target struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references where to set results
reppointer to a replicator which contains the data for replication
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 298 of file bufrdeco_compressed.c.

299{
300 int res;
301 size_t i, k;
302 size_t ixloop; // Index for loop
303 size_t ixd; // Index for descriptor
304 struct bufrdeco_compressed_ref *rf;
305 struct bufr_replicator replicator;
306 struct bufr_sequence *l = rep->s; // sequence
307
308 // if no loops the we save process time and space in data
309 if ( rep->nloops == 0 )
310 return 0;
311
312
313 // The big loop
314 for ( ixloop = 0; ixloop < rep->nloops; ixloop++ )
315 {
316 for ( ixd = 0; ixd < rep->ndesc ; ixd ++ )
317 {
318 i = ixd + rep->ixdel + 1;
319 switch ( l->lseq[i].f )
320 {
321 case 0:
322 // Get data from table B
323 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
324
325 // First then the data itself
326 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( l->lseq[i] ), 0 ) )
327 {
328 return 1;
329 }
330
331 // Case of defining bitmap 0 31 031
332 if ( l->lseq[i].x == 31 && l->lseq[i].y == 31 && b->state.bitmaping )
333 {
334 if ( rf->ref0 == 0 ) // Assume if ref0 == 0 then all subsets are present in same bits
335 {
336 r->refs[r->nd - b->state.bitmaping].is_bitmaped_by = ( uint32_t ) r->nd ;
337 rf->bitmap_to = r->nd - b->state.bitmaping;
338 bufrdeco_add_to_bitmap ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1], r->nd - b->state.bitmaping, r->nd );
339 }
340 }
341
342 // Process quality data
343 if ( b->state.quality_active &&
344 l->lseq[i].x == 33 )
345 {
346 if ( ixloop == 0 )
347 {
348 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nq; // index un quality_given_by array to set
349 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->quality[k] = r->nd; // Set the value
350 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
351 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
352 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nq )++;
353 else
354 {
355 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for quality vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
356 return 1;
357 }
358 }
359 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
360
361 }
362
363 //case of first order statistics
364 if ( b->state.stat1_active &&
365 l->lseq[i].x == 8 && l->lseq[i].y == 23 )
366 {
367 if ( ixloop == 0 )
368 {
369 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1; // index un stqts
370 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1_desc[k] = r->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
371 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
372 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
373 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 )++;
374 else
375 {
376 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for first order statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
377 return 1;
378 }
379 }
380 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
381 }
382
383 //case of difference statistics
384 if ( b->state.dstat_active &&
385 l->lseq[i].x == 8 && l->lseq[i].y == 24 )
386 {
387 if ( ixloop == 0 )
388 {
389 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds; // index un stqts
390 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->dstat_desc[k] = r->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
391 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
392 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
393 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds )++;
394 else
395 {
396 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for difference statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
397 return 1;
398 }
399 }
400 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
401 }
402
403 //print_bufrdeco_compressed_ref ( rf );
404 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ -1 ) )
405 {
406 r->nd += 1;
407 }
408 else
409 {
410 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
411 return 1;
412 }
413
414 // Then associated field
415 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
416 res = bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( l->lseq[i] ), 1 );
417 if ( res > 0 )
418 {
419 return 1; // case of error
420 }
421 else if ( res == 0 )
422 {
423 //print_bufrdeco_compressed_ref ( rf );
424 // associated field read with success
425 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
426 {
427 r->nd += 1;
428 }
429 else
430 {
431 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
432 return 1;
433 }
434 b->state.assoc_bits = 0; // Set again the assoc_bits to 0
435 }
436
437 break;
438
439 case 1:
440 // Case of replicator descriptor
441 replicator.s = l;
442 replicator.ixrep = i;
443 if ( l->lseq[i].y != 0 )
444 {
445 // no delayed
446 replicator.ixdel = i;
447 replicator.ndesc = l->lseq[i].x;
448 replicator.nloops = l->lseq[i].y;
449 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed ( r, & replicator, b );
450 ixd += replicator.ndesc; // update ixd properly
451 }
452 else
453 {
454 // case of delayed;
455 replicator.ixdel = i + 1;
456 replicator.ndesc = l->lseq[i].x;
457 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
458
459 // The data itself to get the loops
460 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( l->lseq[i + 1] ), 0 ) )
461 {
462 return 1;
463 }
464 //print_bufrdeco_compressed_ref ( rf );
465 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
466 {
467 r->nd += 1;
468 }
469 else
470 {
471 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
472 return 1;
473 }
474 replicator.nloops = ( size_t ) rf->ref0;
475 }
476
477 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed ( r, &replicator, b );
478 ixd += replicator.ndesc + 1; // update ixd properly
479
480 //i = rep->ixdel + rep->ndesc; // update i properly
481 break;
482
483 case 2:
484 // Case of operator descriptor
485 if ( bufrdeco_parse_f2_compressed ( r, & ( l->lseq[i] ), b ) )
486 {
487 return 1;
488 }
489
490 // Case of subsituted values
491 if ( b->state.subs_active && l->lseq[i].x == 23 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
492 {
493 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop]; // ref which is bitmaped_to
494 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
495 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
496 if ( ixloop == 0 )
497 {
498 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->subs = r->nd;
499 }
500 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( l->lseq[k] ), 0 ) )
501 {
502 return 1;
503 }
504 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
505
506 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
507 {
508 r->nd += 1;
509 }
510 else
511 {
512 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
513 return 1;
514 }
515 }
516
517 // Case of repaced/retained values
518 if ( b->state.retained_active && l->lseq[i].x == 32 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
519 {
520 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
521 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
522 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
523 if ( ixloop == 0 )
524 {
525 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->retain = r->nd;
526 }
527 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( l->lseq[k] ), 0 ) )
528 {
529 return 1;
530 }
531
532 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
533 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
534 {
535 r->nd += 1;
536 }
537 else
538 {
539 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
540 return 1;
541 }
542 }
543
544 // Case of first order statistics
545 //
546 // This operator shall signify a data item containing a
547 // first-order statistical value of the type indicated by
548 // the preceding 0 08 023 element descriptor; the
549 // element descriptor to which the first-order statistic
550 // relates is obtained by the application of the data
551 // present bit-map associated with the first-order
552 // statistical values follow operator; first-order statistical
553 // values shall be represented as defined by this element
554 // descriptor.
555 if ( b->state.stat1_active && l->lseq[i].x == 24 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
556 {
557 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
558
559 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
560 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
561 if ( ixloop == 0 )
562 {
563 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1[b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 -1] = r->nd;
564 }
565
566 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( r->refs[k].desc ), 0 ) )
567 {
568 return 1;
569 }
570 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
571 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
572 {
573 r->nd += 1;
574 }
575 else
576 {
577 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
578 return 1;
579 }
580 }
581
582 // Case of difference statistics
583 //
584 // This operator shall signify a data item containing a
585 // difference statistical value of the type indicated by
586 // the preceding 0 08 024 element descriptor; the
587 // element descriptor to which the difference statistical
588 // value relates is obtained by the application of the
589 // data present bit-map associated with the difference
590 // statistical values follow operator; difference statistical
591 // values shall be represented as defined by this
592 // element descriptor, but with a reference value of –2**n
593 // and a data width of (n+1), where n is the data width
594 // given by the original descriptor. This special reference
595 // value allows the statistical difference values to
596 // be centred around zero.
597 if ( b->state.dstat_active && l->lseq[i].x == 25 && l->lseq[i].y == 255 )
598 {
599 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
600
601 // Get the bitmaped descriptor k
602 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
603 if ( ixloop == 0 )
604 {
605 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1[b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds -1] = r->nd;
606 }
607
608 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( r->refs[k].desc ), 0 ) )
609 {
610 return 1;
611 }
612
613 // here is where we change ref and bits
614 rf->ref = - ( ( int32_t ) 1 << rf->bits );
615 rf->bits++;
616 rf->related_to = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->bitmap_to[ixloop];
617 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
618 {
619 r->nd += 1;
620 }
621 else
622 {
623 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
624 return 1;
625 }
626 }
627
628 if ( l->lseq[i].x == 5 ) // cases wich produces a new ref
629 {
630 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
631 {
632 r->nd += 1;
633 }
634 else
635 {
636 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
637 return 1;
638 }
639 }
640 break;
641
642 case 3:
643 // Case of sequence descriptor
644 if ( bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive ( r, l->sons[i], b ) )
645 return 1;
646 break;
647
648 default:
649 // this case is not possible
650 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Found bad 'f' in descriptor\n" );
651 return 1;
652 break;
653 }
654 }
655 }
656 return 0;
657}
BUFR_NMAXSEQ
#define BUFR_NMAXSEQ
Maximum expected descriptors in a expanded sequence for a single subset.
Definition: bufrdeco.h:102

References bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::assoc_bits, bufrdeco::bitmap, bufrdeco_bitmap::bitmap_to, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::bitmap_to, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::bitmaping, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::bits, bufrdeco_bitmap_array::bmap, BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA, BUFR_NMAXSEQ, bufrdeco_add_to_bitmap(), bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(), bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive(), bufrdeco_parse_f2_compressed(), bufrdeco_tableb_compressed(), bufrdeco_compressed_ref::desc, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::dstat_active, bufrdeco_bitmap::dstat_desc, bufrdeco::error, bufr_descriptor::f, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::is_bitmaped_by, bufr_replicator::ixdel, bufr_replicator::ixrep, bufr_sequence::lseq, bufrdeco_bitmap_array::nba, bufrdeco_compressed_data_references::nd, bufr_replicator::ndesc, bufrdeco_bitmap::nds, bufr_replicator::nloops, bufrdeco_bitmap::nq, bufrdeco_bitmap::ns1, bufrdeco_bitmap::quality, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::quality_active, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::ref, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::ref0, bufrdeco_compressed_data_references::refs, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::related_to, bufrdeco_bitmap::retain, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::retained_active, bufr_replicator::s, bufr_sequence::sons, bufrdeco_bitmap::stat1, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::stat1_active, bufrdeco_bitmap::stat1_desc, bufrdeco::state, bufrdeco_bitmap::subs, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::subs_active, bufr_descriptor::x, and bufr_descriptor::y.

◆ bufrdeco_decode_subset_data_recursive()

int bufrdeco_decode_subset_data_recursive ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  s,
struct bufr_sequence *  l,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

decode the data from a subset in a recursive way

Parameters
spointer to the target struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data
lpointer to the source struct bufr_sequence
bpointer to the base struct bufrdeco

Return 0 in case of success, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 154 of file bufrdeco_data.c.

155{
156 size_t i, k;
157 struct bufr_sequence *seq;
158 struct bufr_replicator replicator;
159
160 // clean subset data
161 if ( l == NULL )
162 {
163 //memset ( s, 0, sizeof ( struct bufr_subset_sequence_data ) );
164 s->nd = 0;
165 s->ss = b->state.subset;
166 seq = & ( b->tree->seq[0] );
167 if ( b->state.subset == 0 )
168 {
169 b->state.bit_offset = 0;
170 }
171 // also reset reference and bits inc
172 b->state.added_bit_length = 0;
173 b->state.added_scale = 0;
174 b->state.added_reference = 0;
175 b->state.assoc_bits = 0;
176 b->state.changing_reference = 255;
177 b->state.fixed_ccitt = 0;
178 b->state.local_bit_reserved = 0;
179 b->state.factor_reference = 1;
180 b->state.quality_active = 0;
181 b->state.subs_active = 0;
182 b->state.retained_active = 0;
183 b->state.stat1_active = 0;
184 b->state.dstat_active = 0;
185 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
186 b->state.bitmap = NULL;
187 }
188 else
189 {
190 seq = l;
191 }
192
193 // loop for a sequence
194 for ( i = 0; i < seq->ndesc ; i++ )
195 {
196 switch ( seq->lseq[i].f )
197 {
198 case 0:
199 // Get data from table B
200 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( seq->lseq[i] ) ) )
201 {
202 return 1;
203 }
204
205 //case of first order statistics
206 if ( b->state.stat1_active &&
207 seq->lseq[i].x == 8 && seq->lseq[i].y == 23 )
208 {
209 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1; // index un stqts
210 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1_desc[k] = s->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
211 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
212 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
213 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 )++;
214 else
215 {
216 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for first order statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
217 return 1;
218 }
219 }
220
221 //case of difference statistics
222 if ( b->state.dstat_active &&
223 seq->lseq[i].x == 8 && seq->lseq[i].y == 24 )
224 {
225 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds; // index in stats
226 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->dstat_desc[k] = s->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
227 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
228 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
229 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds )++;
230 else
231 {
232 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for difference statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
233 return 1;
234 }
235 }
236
237
238
239 // Add info about common sequence to which bufr_atom_data belongs
240 s->sequence[s->nd].seq = seq;
241 s->sequence[s->nd].ns = i;
242
243 //bufr_print_atom_data_stdout(& ( s->sequence[s->nd] ));
244 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
245 {
246 ( s->nd ) ++;
247 }
248 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
249 {
250 ( s->nd ) ++;
251 }
252 else
253 {
254 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_data_subset_recursive(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
255 return 1;
256 }
257 break;
258
259 case 1:
260 // Case of replicator descriptor
261 replicator.s = seq;
262 replicator.ixrep = i;
263 if ( seq->lseq[i].y != 0 )
264 {
265 // no delayed
266 replicator.ixdel = i;
267 replicator.ndesc = seq->lseq[i].x;
268 replicator.nloops = seq->lseq[i].y;
269
270 // Check if this replicator is for a bit-map defining
271 if ( b->state.bitmaping )
272 {
273 b->state.bitmaping = replicator.nloops; // set it properly
274 }
275
276
277 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence ( s, &replicator, b );
278
279 // and then set again bitamping to 0, because it is finished
280 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
281
282 i += replicator.ndesc;
283 }
284 else
285 {
286 // case of delayed;
287 replicator.ixdel = i + 1;
288 replicator.ndesc = seq->lseq[i].x;
289 // here we read ndesc from delayed replicator descriptor
290 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_val ( & ( s->sequence[s->nd] ), b, & ( seq->lseq[i + 1] ) ) )
291 {
292 return 1;
293 }
294 // Add info about common sequence to which bufr_atom_data belongs
295 s->sequence[s->nd].seq = seq;
296 s->sequence[s->nd].ns = i + 1;
297
298 replicator.nloops = ( size_t ) ( s->sequence[s->nd].val );
299
300 // Check if this replicator is for a bit-map defining
301 if ( b->state.bitmaping )
302 {
303 b->state.bitmaping = replicator.nloops; // set it properly
304 }
305
306 if ( s->nd < ( s->dim - 1 ) )
307 {
308 ( s->nd ) ++;
309 }
310 else if ( bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( s ) == 0 )
311 {
312 ( s->nd ) ++;
313 }
314 else
315 {
316
317 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_data_subset_recursive(): No more bufr_atom_data available. Check BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
318 return 1;
319 }
320 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence ( s, &replicator, b );
321
322 // and then set again bitamping to 0, because it is finished
323 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
324
325 i += replicator.ndesc + 1;
326 }
327 //i = replicator.ixdel + replicator.ndesc; // update i properly
328 break;
329
330 case 2:
331 // Case of operator descriptor
332 if ( bufrdeco_parse_f2_descriptor ( s, & ( seq->lseq[i] ), b ) )
333 {
334 return 1;
335 }
336 break;
337
338 case 3:
339 // Case of sequence descriptor
340 if ( bufrdeco_decode_subset_data_recursive ( s, seq->sons[i], b ) )
341 {
342 return 1;
343 }
344 break;
345
346 default:
347 // this case is not possible
348 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_decode_data_subset_recursive(): Found bad 'f' in descriptor\n" );
349 return 1;
350 break;
351 }
352 }
353 return 0;
354};

Find the index of a line in table C for a given key of a descriptor.

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ bufrdeco_extract_bufr()

int bufrdeco_extract_bufr ( struct bufrdeco *  b,
char *  filename 
)

Read file and try to find a bufr report inserted in. Once found do the same that bufrdeco_read_file()

Parameters
bpointer to struct bufrdeco
filenamecomplete path of BUFR file

This function does the folowing tasks:

  • Try to find first buffer of bytes begining with 'BUFR' chars and ending with '7777'. This will be considered as a bufr file.
  • Read the file and checks the marks at the begining and end to see wheter is a BUFR file
  • Init the structs and allocate the needed memory if not done previously
  • Splits and parse the BUFR sections (without expanding descriptors nor parsing data)
  • Reads the needed Table files and store them in memory.

Returns 0 if all is OK, 1 otherwise

< pointer to a memory buffer where we write raw bufr file

Definition at line 116 of file bufrdeco_read.c.

117{
118 int aux, res;
119 uint8_t *bufrx = NULL, *pbeg = NULL; /*!< pointer to a memory buffer where we write raw bufr file */
120 size_t n = 0, beg, end, size = 0;
121 FILE *fp;
122 struct stat st;
123
124 /* Stat input file */
125 if ( stat ( filename, &st ) < 0 )
126 {
127 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_bufr(): cannot stat file '%s'\n", filename );
128 return 1;
129 }
130
131 /* Alloc nedeed memory for bufr */
132 if ( S_ISREG ( st.st_mode ) || S_ISLNK ( st.st_mode ) )
133 {
134 if ( ( bufrx = ( uint8_t * ) calloc ( 1, st.st_size + 4 ) ) == NULL )
135 {
136 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_bufr(): cannot alloc memory for file '%s'\n", filename );
137 return 1;
138 }
139 }
140 else
141 {
142 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_bufr(): '%s' is not a regular file nor symbolic link\n", filename );
143 return 1;
144 }
145
146 /* Inits bufr struct */
147 if ( ( st.st_size + 4 ) >= BUFR_LEN )
148 {
149 sprintf ( b->error, "File '%s' too large. Consider increase BUFR_LEN\n", filename );
150 free ( ( void * ) bufrx );
151 return 1;
152 }
153
154 // Open and read the file
155 if ( ( fp = fopen ( filename, "r" ) ) == NULL )
156 {
157 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_read_bufr(): cannot open file '%s'\n", filename );
158 free ( ( void * ) bufrx );
159 return 1;
160 }
161
162 beg = end = st.st_size;
163 while ( ( aux = fgetc ( fp ) ) != EOF && ( int ) n < st.st_size )
164 {
165 bufrx[n++] = ( uint8_t ) aux;
166
167 // check if first 'BUFR' item has been found
168 if ( n >= 4 &&
169 bufrx[n - 4] == 'B' &&
170 bufrx[n - 3] == 'U' &&
171 bufrx[n - 2] == 'F' &&
172 bufrx[n - 1] == 'R' )
173 {
174 beg = n - 4;
175 pbeg = &bufrx[ n - 4];
176 }
177
178 // check if first '7777' has been found after first 'BUFR'
179 if ( n > 4 &&
180 beg < ( (size_t) st.st_size - 4 ) &&
181 bufrx[n - 4] == '7' &&
182 bufrx[n - 3] == '7' &&
183 bufrx[n - 2] == '7' &&
184 bufrx[n - 1] == '7' )
185 {
186 end = n - 1;
187 size = end - beg + 1;
188 }
189 }
190
191
192 // close the file
193 fclose ( fp );
194
195 if ( size < 8 )
196 {
197 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_extract_bufr(): not found a '7777' item after 'BUFR'\n" );
198 return 1;
199 }
200 res = bufrdeco_read_buffer ( b, pbeg, size );
201 free ( bufrx );
202 return res;
203}
BUFR_LEN
#define BUFR_LEN
Max length of a BUFR file.
Definition: bufrdeco.h:46

◆ bufrdeco_get_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref()

int bufrdeco_get_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref ( struct bufr_atom_data *  a,
struct bufrdeco_compressed_ref *  r,
size_t  subset,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

Get atom data from a descriptor for a given subset.

Parameters
apointer to the target struct bufr_atom_data where to set the results
rpointer to the struct bufrdeco_compressed_ref with the info to know how and where get the data
subsetindex for solicited subset. First subset has index 0
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 670 of file bufrdeco_compressed.c.

672{
673 size_t i, bit_offset;
674 uint8_t has_data;
675 uint32_t ival, ival0;
676 int32_t ivals;
677 struct bufr_tableb *tb;
678
679 if ( is_a_local_descriptor ( & ( r->desc ) ) )
680 {
681 a->mask = DESCRIPTOR_IS_LOCAL;
682 memcpy ( & ( a->desc ), & ( r->desc ), sizeof ( struct bufr_descriptor ) );
683 strcpy ( a->name, "LOCAL DESCRIPTOR" );
684 strcpy ( a->unit, "UNKNOWN" );
685 if ( r->inc_bits )
686 {
687 bit_offset = r->bit0 + r->bits + 6 + r->inc_bits * subset;
688 // extract inc_bits data
689 if ( get_bits_as_uint32_t ( &ival, &has_data, &b->sec4.raw[4], & bit_offset, r->inc_bits ) == 0 )
690 {
691 sprintf ( b->error, "get_bufr_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref(): Cannot get associated bits from '%s'\n", r->desc.c );
692 return 1;
693 }
694 a->val = ival + r->ref0;
695 }
696 else
697 a->val = r->ref0;
698 return 0;
699 }
700
701 // some utils pointers
702 tb = & ( b->tables->b );
703 i = tb->x_start[r->desc.x] + tb->y_ref[r->desc.x][r->desc.y];
704
705 a->mask = 0;
706
707 // descriptor
708 memcpy ( & ( a->desc ), & ( r->desc ), sizeof ( struct bufr_descriptor ) );
709 // name
710 strcpy ( a->name, r->name );
711 //unit
712 strcpy ( a->unit, r->unit );
713 //scale
714 a->escale = r->escale;
715
716 // possible bitmaps
717 if ( r->is_bitmaped_by )
718 {
719 a->is_bitmaped_by = r->is_bitmaped_by;
720 }
721
722 if ( r->bitmap_to )
723 {
724 a->bitmap_to = r->bitmap_to;
725 }
726
727 // Possible quality
728 if ( r->related_to )
729 {
730 a->related_to = r->related_to;
731 }
732
733
734 // First we check about string fields
735 if ( strstr ( a->unit, "CCITT" ) != NULL )
736 {
737 if ( r->has_data == 0 )
738 {
739 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_VALUE_MISSING;
740 return 0;
741 }
742
743 if ( r->inc_bits == 0 )
744 {
745 // case of all data same, so copy the local ref
746 strcpy ( a->cval, r->cref0 );
747 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_HAVE_STRING_VALUE;
748 }
749 else
750 {
751 // we have to extract chars from section data
752 // compute the bit_offset
753 bit_offset = r->bit0 + r->bits + 6 + r->inc_bits * 8 * subset;
754 if ( get_bits_as_char_array ( a->cval, &has_data, &b->sec4.raw[4], & bit_offset, r->inc_bits * 8 ) == 0 )
755 {
756 sprintf ( b->error, "get_bufr_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref(): Cannot get uchars from '%s'\n", r->desc.c );
757 return 1;
758 }
759 if ( has_data == 0 )
760 {
761 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_VALUE_MISSING;
762 }
763 else
764 {
765 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_HAVE_STRING_VALUE;
766 }
767 }
768 return 0;
769 }
770
771 // now we check for associated data
772 if ( r->is_associated )
773 {
774 strcpy ( a->name, "Associated value" );
775 strcpy ( a->unit, "Associated unit" );
776 if ( r->has_data == 0 )
777 {
778 a->associated = MISSING_INTEGER;
779 }
780 else
781 {
782 if ( r->inc_bits == 0 )
783 {
784 // case of all data same, so copy the local ref
785 a->associated = r->ref0;
786 }
787 else
788 {
789 // compute the bit_offset
790 bit_offset = r->bit0 + r->bits + 6 + r->inc_bits * subset;
791 // extract inc_bits data
792 if ( get_bits_as_uint32_t ( &ival, &has_data, &b->sec4.raw[4], & bit_offset, r->inc_bits ) == 0 )
793 {
794 sprintf ( b->error, "get_bufr_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref(): Cannot get associated bits from '%s'\n", r->desc.c );
795 return 1;
796 }
797 // finally get the associated data
798 if ( has_data )
799 {
800 a->associated = r->ref + ( int32_t ) ( r->ref0 + ival );
801 }
802 else
803 {
804 a->associated = MISSING_INTEGER;
805 }
806 }
807 }
808 return 0;
809 }
810
811 // numeric data
812 if ( r->has_data == 0 ||
813 r->inc_bits > 31 ) // ¿no more than 31 inc_bits for numeric data?
814 {
815 a->val = MISSING_REAL;
816 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_VALUE_MISSING;
817 return 0;
818 }
819
820 if ( r->inc_bits == 0 )
821 {
822 ivals = r->ref + ( int32_t ) r->ref0;
823 }
824 else
825 {
826 // read inc_bits data
827 // compute the bit_offset
828 bit_offset = r->bit0 + r->bits + 6 + r->inc_bits * subset;
829 // extract inc_bits data
830 if ( get_bits_as_uint32_t ( &ival0, &has_data, &b->sec4.raw[4], & bit_offset, r->inc_bits ) == 0 )
831 {
832 sprintf ( b->error, "get_bufr_atom_data_from_compressed_data_ref(): Cannot get %d inc_bits from '%s'\n", r->inc_bits , r->desc.c );
833 return 1;
834 }
835
836 if ( has_data )
837 {
838 ivals = r->ref + ( int32_t ) ( r->ref0 + ival0 );
839 }
840 else
841 {
842 a->val = MISSING_REAL;
843 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_VALUE_MISSING;
844 return 0;
845 }
846 }
847
848 // Get a numeric number
849 a->val = ( double ) ( ivals ) * exp10 ( ( double ) ( - r->escale ) );
850
851 //printf("ival = %lf\n", a->val);
852 if ( strstr ( a->unit, "CODE TABLE" ) == a->unit || strstr ( a->unit, "Code table" ) == a->unit )
853 {
854 ival = ( uint32_t ) ( a->val + 0.5 );
855 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_IS_CODE_TABLE;
856 if ( bufrdeco_explained_table_val ( a->ctable, 256, & ( b->tables->c ), & ( tb->item[i].tablec_ref ), & ( a->desc ), ival ) != NULL )
857 {
858 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_HAVE_CODE_TABLE_STRING;
859 }
860 }
861 else if ( strstr ( a->unit,"FLAG" ) == a->unit || strstr ( a->unit,"Flag" ) == a->unit )
862 {
863 ival = ( uint32_t ) ( a->val + 0.5 );
864 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_IS_FLAG_TABLE;
865
866 if ( bufrdeco_explained_flag_val ( a->ctable, 256, & ( b->tables->c ), & ( a->desc ), ival, r->bits ) != NULL )
867 {
868 a->mask |= DESCRIPTOR_HAVE_FLAG_TABLE_STRING;
869 }
870 }
871
872 return 0;
873}

◆ bufrdeco_get_subset_sequence_data()

struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data * bufrdeco_get_subset_sequence_data ( struct bufrdeco *  b)

Parse and get a struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data.

Parameters
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

Note that if succeeded the counter to current subset index is increased. Remember that in case of non compressed data we must to decode all previous subsets to get the desired one. In case of compressed we can access directly to a the desired subset

If succeeded returns a pointer to the struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data with the results for a subset, otherwise returns NULL

Definition at line 38 of file bufrdeco_data.c.

39{
40 if ( bufrdeco_decode_data_subset ( & ( b->seq ), & ( b->refs ), b ) )
41 {
42 return NULL;
43 }
44 return & ( b->seq );
45}

◆ bufrdeco_get_version()

char * bufrdeco_get_version ( char *  version,
char *  build,
char *  builder,
int *  version_major,
int *  version_minor,
int *  version_patch 
)

Get strings with version information and build date and time.

Parameters
versionpointer to string with version as result if not NULL
buildpointer to string with compiler and compilation date and time if not NULL
builderpointer to string with builder utility. 'cmake' or 'autotools' if not NULL
version_majorpointer to string with version_major component if not NULL
version_minorpointer to string with version_minor component if not NULL
version_patchpointer to string with version_patch component if not NULL

Retuns string pointer version.

Definition at line 43 of file bufrdeco.c.

44{
45 int major = 0, minor = 0, patch = 0;
46 char *c;
47 if (version == NULL)
48 return NULL;
49 sprintf(version, "%s", VERSION);
50 // default values
51 sscanf(version, "%d.%d.%d", &major, &minor, &patch);
52
53 if (build)
54 {
55 c = build;
56#if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
57 c += sprintf(build, "using INTEL C compiler icc %d.%d ", __INTEL_COMPILER, __INTEL_COMPILER_UPDATE);
58#elif defined(__GNUC__)
59 c += sprintf(build, "using GNU C compiler gcc %d.%d.%d ", __GNUC__ , __GNUC_MINOR__ , __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__);
60#endif
61 sprintf(c,"at %s %s",__DATE__,__TIME__);
62 }
63
64 if (builder)
65#ifdef BUILD_USING_CMAKE
66 strcpy(builder, "cmake");
67#else
68 strcpy(builder, "autotools");
69#endif
70 if (version_major)
71 *version_major = major;
72 if (version_minor)
73 *version_minor = minor;
74 if (version_patch)
75 *version_patch = patch;
76 return version;
77}

◆ bufrdeco_increase_data_array()

int bufrdeco_increase_data_array ( struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data *  s)

doubles the allocated space for a struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data whenever is posible

Parameters
spointer to source struct bufrdeco_subset_sequence_data

The amount of data in a bufr must be huge. In a first moment, the dimension of a sequence of structs bufr_atom_data is BUFR_NMAXSEQ but may be increased. This function task is try to double the allocated dimension and reallocate it.

Return 0 when success, otherwise return 1 and the struct is unmodified

Definition at line 124 of file bufrdeco_data.c.

125{
126 if ( s->dim < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ * 8 ) ) // check if reached the limit
127 {
128 if ( ( s->sequence = ( struct bufr_atom_data * ) realloc ( ( void * ) s->sequence,
129 s->dim * 2 * sizeof ( struct bufr_atom_data ) ) ) == NULL )
130 {
131 return 1;
132 }
133 else
134 {
135 s->dim *= 2;
136 return 0;
137 }
138 }
139 else
140 {
141 return 1;
142 }
143}

This function only must be called once. When finished the function bufrdeco_close must be called to free all needed memory

◆ bufrdeco_parse_compressed()

int bufrdeco_parse_compressed ( struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references *  r,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

Parse a compressed data bufr.

Parameters
rpointer to a struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references where to set the results
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

When a bufr report has compressed data, it is needed to do a first parse step to get references about where to find the data for every descriptor in subsets. This is what this function does. If succeeded the struct r will have all needed data to decode individual subsets.

Also be mind that the descriptors tree have to be already parsed when calling this function

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 40 of file bufrdeco_compressed.c.

41{
42 // Check about parsed tree
43 if ( b->tree == NULL || b->tree->nseq == 0 )
44 {
45 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_parse_compressed(): Try to parse compressed data without parsed tree\n" );
46 return 1;
47 }
48
49 // first we assure that needed memory is allocated and array of references initizalized
50 if ( bufrdeco_init_compressed_data_references ( r ) )
51 {
52 return 1;
53 }
54
55 // Then we make the parsing task in a recursive way. NULL pointer says it is the begining.
56 if ( bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive ( r, NULL, b ) )
57 {
58 return 1;
59 }
60
61 // all is OK
62 return 0;
63}
bufrdeco_init_compressed_data_references

◆ bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive()

int bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive ( struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references *  r,
struct bufr_sequence *  l,
struct bufrdeco *  b 
)

Parse recursively the compressed data in a bufr report to get references where to get data for every descriptor in a subset.

Parameters
rpointer to target struct bufrdeco_compressed_data_references where to set results
lpointer to a struct bufr_sequence to parse in this call. If NULL then it is first root sequence
bbasic container struct bufrdeco

Returns 0 if succeeded, 1 otherwise

Definition at line 75 of file bufrdeco_compressed.c.

76{
77 int res;
78 size_t i, k;
79 struct bufr_sequence *seq; // auxiliar pointer
80 struct bufrdeco_compressed_ref *rf;
81 struct bufr_replicator replicator;
82
83 if ( l == NULL )
84 {
85 // inits the array
86 // At the moment there are no structs bufrdeco_compressed ref
87 r->nd = 0;
88 // set the auxiliar pointer at the begining
89 seq = & ( b->tree->seq[0] );
90 // Cleans the state of parsing
91 memset ( & ( b->state ), 0, sizeof ( struct bufrdeco_decoding_data_state ) );
92 // and set some other initial values
93 b->state.bit_offset = 0;
94 b->state.added_bit_length = 0;
95 b->state.added_scale = 0;
96 b->state.added_reference = 0;
97 b->state.assoc_bits = 0;
98 b->state.changing_reference = 255;
99 b->state.fixed_ccitt = 0;
100 b->state.local_bit_reserved = 0;
101 b->state.factor_reference = 1;
102 b->state.quality_active = 0;
103 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
104 b->state.bitmap = NULL;
105 }
106 else
107 {
108 // This is the case when layer of sequence is no 0, i.e. has been called recursively
109 // We just set the auxiliar index
110 seq = l;
111 }
112
113 // loop for a sequence
114 for ( i = 0; i < seq->ndesc ; i++ )
115 {
116 // switch according to 'f' of the descriptor of sequence
117 switch ( seq->lseq[i].f )
118 {
119 case 0:
120 // Get data from table B
121 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] ); // pointer to the target struct bufrdeco_compressed ref
122
123 // First the the data itself
124 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( seq->lseq[i] ), 0 ) )
125 {
126 return 1;
127 }
128
129 //case of first order statistics
130 if ( b->state.stat1_active &&
131 seq->lseq[i].x == 8 && seq->lseq[i].y == 23 )
132 {
133 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1; // index un stqts
134 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->stat1_desc[k] = r->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
135 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
136 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
137 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->ns1 )++;
138 else
139 {
140 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for first order statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
141 return 1;
142 }
143 }
144
145 //case of difference statistics
146 if ( b->state.dstat_active &&
147 seq->lseq[i].x == 8 && seq->lseq[i].y == 24 )
148 {
149 k = b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds; // index un stqts
150 b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->dstat_desc[k] = r->nd; // Set the value of statistical parameter
151 // update the number of quality variables for the bitmap
152 if ( k < BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA )
153 ( b->bitmap.bmap[b->bitmap.nba - 1]->nds )++;
154 else
155 {
156 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): No more space for difference statistic vars in bitmap. Check BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA\n" );
157 return 1;
158 }
159 }
160
161 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
162 {
163 r->nd += 1;
164 }
165 else
166 {
167 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_parse_compressed_recursive(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
168 return 1;
169 }
170
171 // Then we check for an associated field
172 // If is not an associated field returned value is -1
173 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
174 res = bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( seq->lseq[i] ), 1 );
175 if ( res > 0 )
176 {
177 return 1; // case of error
178 }
179 else if ( res == 0 )
180 {
181 // print_bufrdeco_compressed_ref ( rf );
182 // associated field read with success
183 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ - 1 ) )
184 {
185 r->nd += 1;
186 }
187 else
188 {
189 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_parse_compressed_recursive(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
190 return 1;
191 }
192 // Update the pointer to the target struct bufrdeco_compressed ref
193 i++; // Update main loop index
194 }
195
196
197 break;
198
199 case 1:
200 // Case of replicator descriptor
201 replicator.s = seq;
202 replicator.ixrep = i;
203 if ( seq->lseq[i].y != 0 )
204 {
205 // no delayed
206 replicator.ixdel = i;
207 replicator.ndesc = seq->lseq[i].x;
208 replicator.nloops = seq->lseq[i].y;
209
210 // Check if this replicator is for a bit-map defining
211 if ( b->state.bitmaping )
212 {
213 b->state.bitmaping = replicator.nloops; // set it properly
214 }
215
216 // call to decode a replicated subsequence
217 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed ( r, &replicator, b );
218
219 // and then set again bitamping to 0, because it is finished
220 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
221 }
222 else
223 {
224 // case of delayed;
225 replicator.ixdel = i + 1;
226 replicator.ndesc = seq->lseq[i].x;
227 rf = & ( r->refs[r->nd] );
228
229 // The the data itself to get the loops
230 if ( bufrdeco_tableb_compressed ( rf, b, & ( seq->lseq[i + 1] ), 0 ) )
231 {
232 return 1;
233 }
234
235 //print_bufrdeco_compressed_ref ( rf );
236 if ( r->nd < ( BUFR_NMAXSEQ -1 ) )
237 {
238 r->nd += 1;
239 }
240 else
241 {
242 sprintf ( b->error, "bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(): Reached limit. Consider increas BUFR_NMAXSEQ\n" );
243 return 1;
244 }
245
246 replicator.nloops = ( size_t ) rf->ref0;
247
248 // Check if this replicator is for a bit-map defining
249 if ( b->state.bitmaping )
250 {
251 b->state.bitmaping = replicator.nloops; // set it properly
252 }
253
254 // call to decode a replicated subsequence
255 bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed ( r, &replicator, b );
256
257 // and then set again bitamping to 0, because it is finished
258 b->state.bitmaping = 0;
259 }
260 i = replicator.ixdel + replicator.ndesc; // update i properly
261 break;
262
263 case 2:
264 // Case of operator descriptor
265 if ( bufrdeco_parse_f2_compressed ( r, & ( seq->lseq[i] ), b ) )
266 {
267 return 1;
268 }
269 break;
270
271 case 3:
272 // Case of sequence descriptor
273 if ( bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive ( r, seq->sons[i], b ) )
274 {
275 return 1;
276 }
277 break;
278
279 default:
280 // this case is not possible
281 sprintf ( b->error, "bufr_parse_compressed_recursive(): Found bad 'f' in descriptor\n" );
282 return 1;
283 break;
284 }
285 }
286 return 0;
287}
bufrdeco_decoding_data_state
stores the state when expanding a sequence.
Definition: bufrdeco.h:391

References bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::added_bit_length, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::added_reference, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::added_scale, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::assoc_bits, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::bit_offset, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::bitmap, bufrdeco::bitmap, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::bitmaping, bufrdeco_bitmap_array::bmap, BUFR_MAX_QUALITY_DATA, BUFR_NMAXSEQ, bufrdeco_decode_replicated_subsequence_compressed(), bufrdeco_parse_compressed_recursive(), bufrdeco_parse_f2_compressed(), bufrdeco_tableb_compressed(), bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::changing_reference, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::dstat_active, bufrdeco_bitmap::dstat_desc, bufrdeco::error, bufr_descriptor::f, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::factor_reference, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::fixed_ccitt, bufr_replicator::ixdel, bufr_replicator::ixrep, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::local_bit_reserved, bufr_sequence::lseq, bufrdeco_bitmap_array::nba, bufrdeco_compressed_data_references::nd, bufr_replicator::ndesc, bufr_sequence::ndesc, bufrdeco_bitmap::nds, bufr_replicator::nloops, bufrdeco_bitmap::ns1, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::quality_active, bufrdeco_compressed_ref::ref0, bufrdeco_compressed_data_references::refs, bufr_replicator::s, bufrdeco_expanded_tree::seq, bufr_sequence::sons, bufrdeco_decoding_data_state::stat1_active, bufrdeco_bitmap::stat1_desc, bufrdeco::state, bufrdeco::tree, bufr_descriptor::x, and bufr_descriptor::y.
